Task:
  The response selects or isolates information already present without introducing new content.
constraints: Completeness ("deep"): The response goes into substantial depth within the chosen scope, unpacking reasoning layers and fine details without necessarily enumerating every edge case.
Scope ("good"): The response focuses on how quality, success, or goodness is judged—criteria, metrics, value, taste, or standards of assessment.
Method ("systemic"): The response analyses the subject as a whole system, including components, boundaries, flows, and feedback loops.
Form ("indirect"): The response begins with brief background, reasoning, and trade-offs and finishes with a clear bottom-line point or recommendation that ties them together.
Channel ("jira"): The response formats the content using Jira markup (headings, lists, panels) where relevant and avoids extra explanation beyond the main material.
